recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Cooked couscous or rice, for serving
Soak the dried chickpeas in water overnight or for at least 8 hours. Drain and rinse before using.
In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add the soaked chickpeas to the pot along with the cumin, paprika, coriander, ginger, turmeric, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper. Stir to coat the chickpeas in the spices and cook for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and water. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer. Cover the pot and let it cook for 1 hour, or until the chickpeas are tender.
After 1 hour, add the frozen okra to the stew and season with salt and pepper to taste. Let it cook for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve the over cooked couscous or rice. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.
This hearty stew is packed with flavor and nutrients. The combination of tender chickpeas, flavorful spices, and tender okra make for a delicious and satisfying meal.
Enjoy this Moroccan-inspired dish for a taste of something new and exotic.

267 73 183 773 _Indonesian Spiced Rice         _


Ingredients Required
__________

1 12 tablespoons oil

1 large onion , chopped

1 (4 ounce) can green chilies, chopped

12 teaspoon turmeric     

14 teaspoon cinnamon

12 lb white rice    

1 (14 12 ounce) can vegetable broth

2 12 tablespoons water      

1 bay leaf

18 teaspoon cayenne pepper    


Directions to Prepare
__________

Heat    oil in a large    heavy saucepan over medium heat .

Add chopped onion    and chilies and stir until onion    is translucent.

Mix in turmeric     and cinnamon.

Add rice    and stir 2 minutes.

Add vegetable broth, water, bay leaf and cayenne pepper .

Bring to a boil; reduce heat , cover and cook until liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes.

Sprinkle green onions    on top before serving.

Serve

ingredients: Cooked rice      or traditional meal, for serving
While the mince is rehydrating, chop the onions , garlic , and mushrooms  into small pieces.
In a large pan or skillet, heat the olive  oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions  and garlic , and cook until softened and fragrant.
Add the mushrooms  to the pan and continue cooking until they have softened and released their juices.
Remove the mushrooms , onions , and garlic  from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the rehydrated soya mince and cook for a few minutes until it starts to brown.
Pour the vegetable broth into the pan and stir well, scraping up any bits stuck to the bottom.
Add the cooked mushrooms , onions , and garlic  back into the pan with the soya mince. Stir in the salt  to taste.
Allow the mixture to simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has reduced and the flavors have melded together.
Stir in the sour cream until well combined. Let the stroganoff cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve the stroganoff over cooked rice or traditional meal and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.

This is a delicious and hearty vegetarian meal that is sure to satisfy. The combination of rehydrated soya mince and earthy mushrooms creates a rich and flavorful dish that is perfect for a cozy dinner at home. Serve it over your choice of rice or traditional meal for a complete meal.

Samp and Vegetable Curry
ingredients: In a large pot , bring 4 cups of water     to a boil. Add the samp and let it cook for 30 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat    the olive    oil over medium heat . Add the onion , garlic , red bell pepper    and carrot . Saute for 5 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Add the chopped broccoli    and continue to cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in the cooked samp, dried thyme, dried oregano, salt . Mix well until all the ingredients are combined.
Pour the vegetable broth over the mixture and stir to combine. Let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Grease a casserole dish with some olive    oil. Transfer the samp and vegetable mixture into the casserole dish.
Sprinkle the frozen peas    on top of the casserole.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes, remove the aluminum foil and bake for another 10 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious meal

recipes.name: Tofu and Vegetable Stir Fry with Peanut ğŸ¥œ ğŸ¥œ ğŸ¥œ Sauce
ingredients: Preheat your oven to 350ÂºF (180ÂºC). Grease a loaf pan with vegetable oil and set aside.
In a large bowl, mash 2 ripe bananas with a fork until smooth. Add in 500g of firm tofu and mash together until well combined.
In a separate bowl, mix together 1 1/2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup of cocoa powder, 1 tsp of baking powder, 1 tsp of baking soda, 1/2 tsp of salt, and 1 tsp of ground cinnamon.
Slowly add the dry ingredients to the banana-tofu mixture, stirring until a batter forms.
In a small bowl, mix together 1/2 cup of brown sugar, 1/4 cup of vegetable oil, and 1 tsp of vanilla extract. Add this mixture to the batter and mix well.
Fold in 1/2 cup of chocolate chips into the batter.
Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
Bake the bread    for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the bread    cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.
Slice and serve your delicious , and enjoy
This bread    will stay fresh for up to 3 days if stored in an airtight container.

recipes.notes:
267 75 841 385 6 Healthy Homemade Salad      Dressings

_These six healthy salad dressing recipes are easy to make and store in your fridge. Try them all or choose your favorites  balsamic, peanut    ginger, apple   cider vinegar, avocado, raspberry  vinaigrette, and honey  mustard salad    dressing._

_Six colorful jars of homemade salad dressing surrounded with vegetables and fruit._

_6 Healthy Salad    Dressings Overview_

Have you ever wondered how you could make your favorite salad dressings in a healthy, more affordable version This post shares 6 healthy salad      dressing recipes that are packed full of nutrition and easy to make

_These salad    dressing recipes are so simple and easy to make. Once you try a few of these recipes youll quickly learn which ones are your favorites and what dishes youd like to pair them with._

These recipes arent just great for salads  You can use them in quinoa bowls, on top of roasted veggies, pasta dishes, or even as a marinade

_All of these dressings are made with whole natural ingredients that youll feel good about sharing with your family. Each recipe makes about 1 Â½ cups, which is the perfect size to store in 8 oz mason jars._

A jar of apple   cider vinegar dressing with ingredients including olive    oil, apple   cider vinegar, dijon mustard, garlic , salt  and pepper.

1. Apple   Cider Vinegar Salad      Dressing

INGREDIENTS

1 cup olive    oil

Â½ cup apple   cider vinegar

Â½ Tbsp dijon mustard

1 garlic  clove  minced

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS

Combine 1 cup olive    oil, Â½ cup apple   cider vinegar, Â½ Tbsp dijon mustard, 1 minced garlic  clove, Â½ tsp salt  and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper in a container or mason jar.

_Seal the lid and shake up to mix. This dressing can be stored in the fridge for up to two weeks. Reshake before using again._

A jar of balsamic dressing with ingredients listed including balsamic vinegar, olive    oil, honey , dijon mustard, garlic , salt , pepper.

2. Balsamic Salad     Dressing Recipe

INGREDIENTS

Â¾ cup balsamic vinegar

Â½ cup olive    oil

1 Tbsp honey  or pure maple syrup

1 tsp dijon mustard

1 garlic  clove  minced

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

_DIRECTIONS Combine Â¾ cup balsamic vinegar, Â½ cup olive    oil, 1 Tbsp honey , 1 tsp dijon mustard, 1 minced garlic  clove, Â½ tsp salt  and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper in a container or mason jar._

Seal the lid and shake up to mix. Store in the fridge for up to two weeks. Re-shake the jar before using it again.

_A mason jar of peanut    butter dressing with ingredients listed beside peanut    butter, soy sauce, lemon    juice, honey , ginger root , and garlic ._

3. Peanut    Butter    Salad    Dressing

INGREDIENTS

Â½ cup peanut    butter  or almond butter

3 Tbsp soy sauce

2 Tbsp honey   or maple syrup

2 Tbsp lemon    juice

Â½ Tbsp freshly grated ginger    

1 garlic  clove  minced

DIRECTIONS Combine Â½ cup peanut    butter, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 Tbsp honey , 2 Tbsp lemon    juice, Â½ Tbsp freshly grated ginger , and 1 minced garlic  clove together in a container or mason jar. Seal the lid and shake up to mix. Store in the fridge for up to two weeks. Re-shake the jar before using it again.

A jar of creamy avocado    dressing with a sliced avocado beside it. Ingredients are listed beside include avocado , cilantro, olive    oil, lime    juice, water , garlic , salt  and pepper.

4. Creamy Avocado    Salad Dressing

INGREDIENTS

1 ripe avocado   peeled and pitted

Â½ cup water     

Â½ cup chopped cilantro

Â¼ cup olive    oil

Â¼ cup lime  juice

1 garlic  clove  minced

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

The instructions for this dressing are below

_DIRECTIONS Add 1 ripe avocado , Â½ cup water , Â½ cup chopped cilantro, Â¼ cup olive    oil, Â¼ cup lime  juice, 1 minced garlic  clove, Â½ tsp salt , and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper all to a blender and blend until smooth and creamy._

Pour into a container or mason jar. Store in the fridge for up to 3-4 days. Re-shake the jar before using it again.

A jar of honey  mustard salad    dressing and ingredients listed including olive    oil, lemon  juice, dijon mustard, honey  salt  and pepper.

5. Honey  Mustard Salad    Dressing

INGREDIENTS

1 cup olive    oil

Â½ cup lemon  juice

2 Tbsp dijon mustard

2 Tbsp honey  

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS Combine 1 cup olive    oil, Â½ cup lemon  juice, 2 Tbsp dijon mustard, 2 Tbsp honey , Â½ tsp salt , and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper in a container or mason jar.

_Seal the lid and shake up to mix. Store in the fridge for up to two weeks. Re-shake the jar before using it again._

A mason jar of raspberry  vinaigrette with a bowl of fresh raspberries and a list of ingredients including raspberries , olive  oil, lemon  juice, apple   cider vinegar, honey  and salt .

6. Raspberry Vinaigrette

INGREDIENTS

1 cup fresh raspberries

Â¼ cup olive    oil

Â¼ cup lemon  juice

3 Tbsp apple   cider vinegar

1 Tbsp honey  or pure maple syrup

Â¼ tsp salt  

The instructions for this dressing are below

_DIRECTIONS Add 1 cup fresh raspberries, Â¼ cup olive oil, Â¼ cup lemon juice, 3 Tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 Tbsp honey and Â¼ tsp salt to a blender and blend until smooth. Pour over salad. This dressing is best when served fresh._

267 75 841 385 _Soya Chunks and Spinach_

_Ingredients_

- 200g soya chunks

- 2 tablespoons olive oil

- 1 onion, diced

- 2 cloves garlic, minced

- 2 carrots, diced

- 1 teaspoon of ground cumin

- 2 cups of vegetable stock

- 1 cup long grain rice

- 2 cups spinach

- Salt to taste

_Method_

1. Soak the soya chunks in water for 10 minutes then drain and set aside.

2. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, garlic, and carrots and cook until softened.

3. Add the cumin and cooked soya chunks and sautÃ© for 1 minute.

4. Add the vegetable stock and rice and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes.

5. Add the spinach and season with salt. Stir to combine and cook for 2 minutes more.

6. Serve and enjoy

267 73 183 773 Healthy Low-Fat Black Bean Veggie Burgers      


Ingredients Required
__________

1 12-2 tablespoons pureed onions    (green onions optional)

1 cup black beans, well drained

1 -3 tablespoon whole wheat flour

1 slice of whole wheat bread , very well crumbled

1 -1 12 teaspoon crushed garlic    

12 teaspoon onion    powder

14 teaspoon seasoning salt  

oil (for frying)


Directions to Prepare
__________

_In a large bowl, mash the beans until almost smooth (or puree with the onions )._

_Add onions    and the rest of the ingredients, except the oil, adding the flour a tablespoon at a time until the mixture is at your desired consistency._

_Form bean mixture into flat patties and fry patties in a small amount of oil until slightly firm._

Serve  topped with hummus or a Greek feta salad    salad dressing, spread on a whole wheat bun. Try these with ketchup.

ingredients: _Spicy Beetroot and Carrot Salad with Cumin and Coriander_
g beetroot, peeled and cut into thin strips
g carrot, peeled and cut into thin strips
In a small pan, toast the cumin and coriander seeds over medium heat until fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and crush the seeds using a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder.
In a mixing bowl, combine the crushed seeds with minced garlic, olive oil, honey, and apple cider vinegar. Whisk until well combined.
Add the beetroot and carrot strips to the dressing and toss to coat evenly. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours, in the refrigerator.
In a separate bowl, toss the mixed salad greens with a pinch of salt and pepper.
To assemble the salad, place the marinated beetroot and carrot strips on top of the mixed greens. Garnish with sliced red chili for an extra kick of heat.
Serve as a side dish or as a light lunch.
Enjoy the spicy, tangy flavors of the beetroot and carrot salad with cumin and coriander.

267 73 183 773 _Spicy Curried Lentils and Rice       _


Ingredients Required
__________

2 teaspoons canola oil or 2 teaspoons vegetable oil

1 12 cups onions , chopped

1 teaspoon ginger , finely minced

2 garlic  cloves, finely minced

1 small hot    pepper , finely minced

1 cup brown lentils or 1 cup green lentil, soaked, rinsed, and drained

12 cup basmati rice or 12 cup other long grain rice    

3 cups water     or 3 cups broth

1 tablespoon curry powder

12-1 teaspoon salt  

1 cup frozen peas , defrosted

1 cup diced tomato    (fresh or canned)

3 -4 tablespoons cilantro, chopped for garnish

hot    sauce or chutney, to taste


Directions to Prepare
__________

_Pour the oil into a medium or large saucepan with a lid over medium heat . Add the onion , ginger root , garlic    and pepper . SautÃ© for 1 to 2 minutes. Cook until onion    begins to slightly soften, about 5 minutes._

 _Add lentils, rice , curry powder, and water . Stir well._

 _Cover the pan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat    to low and simmer for 35 minutes._

 _Remove from heat , add peas    to pot , replace cover and let sit undisturbed for 5 more minutes._

 _Add tomatoes    and salt  and fluff with a fork. Transfer to a serving plate. Top with cilantro._

Serve  immediately.

267 73 183 773 _Lentil Rice Dish  (Mujadarah Arabic Dish)_


Ingredients Required
__________

1 cup lentils

13 cup basmati rice    

4 cups water     or 4 cups vegetable broth

salt  (to taste)

1 teaspoon cumin

14 cup olive    oil or 14 cup vegetable oil

2 large onions , sliced 12 inch slivers


Directions to Prepare
__________

_Saute Onions    with olive    oil(stirring occasionally) until golden brown . Reserve 4 tablespoons of browned onions    for garnish._

 _Place lentils,water ,salt ,in different saucepan and cook over medium heat    for about 20 minutes or until lentils are tender._

 _Add to lentils the uncooked rice ,browned onions    and cumin and mix. Cover and simmer for another 15 minutes or until water is absorbed and rice     is tender._

 _Place Lentils Rice      dish(mujadarah)in serving dish and garnish with 4 tablespoons of browned onions ._

 _Mujadarah is best when served with Tomato    salad ._

Serve

267 73 183 773 Kusherie (Egyptian Rice _   and Lentils)_


Ingredients Required
__________

2 tablespoons oil

1 14 cups lentils

3 cups boiling water     (or stock)

1 teaspoon salt  

1 dash pepper    

1 12 cups rice  

1 cup boiling water     (or stock)

Sauce

34 cup tomato    paste

3 cups tomato    juice (or tomato    sauce or pureed tomatoes )

1 green pepper , chopped

12 cup celery leaves, chopped

1 tablespoon sweetener 

12 teaspoon salt  

1 teaspoon cumin

14 teaspoon cayenne pepper    

Browned Onions    

2 tablespoons oil

3 onions , sliced

4 garlic  cloves, minced


_Directions to Prepare_
__________

_In a large    heavy saucepan over medium heat , brown lentils in 2 Tbsp oil, about 5 minutes, stirring often._

 _Add the 3 cups boiling stock and the salt  and pepper ._

 Cook uncovered for 10 minutes over medium heat .

 Stir in the rice    and 1 cup stock.

 _Bring to boil, reduce heat , cover and simmer 25 minutes without stirring._

 Meanwhile make sauce Heat    all the sauce ingredients together in a medium saucepan.

 _Bring to boil, reduce heat , cover and simmer 20-30 minutes._

 _To make browned onions , heat oil in a small skillet._

 Saute onions    and garlic    over medium heat    till browned.

 _To serve, put rice    lentil mixture on a platter, pour tomato    sauce over and top with browned onions ._

Serve

recipes.name: Diana's Egyptian Lentils & Rice ğŸš ğŸš ğŸš
recipes.notes:
267 73 183 773 _Israeli Rice      and Lentil Stew with Cumin and Garlic   _


Ingredients Required
__________

1 cup lentils

2 cups water    or 2 cups vegetable broth

3 tablespoons vegetable oil

2 large onions , chopped

3 cloves garlic , chopped

1 teaspoon ground cumin

1 12 cups long-grain rice    

salt 

2 tablespoons chopped parsley (optional)

Directions to Prepare
__________

Sort the lentils carefully, discarding any stones.

Rinse lentils, then combine with the water    in a large    saucepan.

Bring to a boil, cover and cook over medium heat    about 20 minutes or until the lentils are just tender.

Drain the liquid into a measuring cup, leaving the lentils in the pan and add enough water    to make 3 cups.

In a heavy skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat .

Add the onions    and saute, stirring occasionally, until they are well browned, about 15 minutes.

Add the garlic    and cumin and saute 30 seconds; reserve.

Add reserved lentil cooking liquid to pan of lentils and bring to a boil.

Add salt  and rice    and return to a boil.

 Add the onion    mixture.

Cover, reduce heat    to low, and cook, without stirring, until the rice    is tender, about 20 minutes.

Fluff gently with a fork.

Season to taste with salt  and lightly stir in parsley if desired.

 Serve  hot .

267 75 841 385 Carrot    Ginger     Soup

 _Ingredients_

- 500g carrots, peeled and roughly chopped

- 1 onion, peeled and diced

- 2 cloves of garlic, peeled and diced

- 2 cm piece of ginger, peeled and grated

- 2 tablespoons of oil

- 500ml vegetable stock

- Salt and pepper to taste

_Method_

1. Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.

2. Add the onion and garlic and cook for 2-3 minutes until softened.

3. Add the ginger and carrots and cook for a further 2 minutes.

4. Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to the boil.

5. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes until the carrots are tender.

6. Remove from the heat and allow to cool slightly.

7. Blend using a hand blender until smooth.

8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

9. Serve warm with crusty bread.

Enjoy

recipes.name: Veggie Samosa with Paneer
ingredients: Heat the oil in a pan on medium heat.
Add cumin seeds and sautÃ© for a few seconds.
Add the green chillies, ginger-garlic paste and sautÃ© until fragrant.
Crumble the paneer and add to the pan, stirring to combine.
Add the garam masala, salt and cashew nuts and stir to combine.
Cook for 5 minutes until the paneer is cooked through.
Remove from heat and set aside.
Cut the samosa pastry into 8 equal pieces and roll each piece into a circle.
Place a heaped tablespoon of the paneer and cashew mix in the center of each circle.
Fold the pastry up around the filling to form a semi-circle.
Seal the edges with a fork or a crimping tool.
Heat oil in a large pan.
Add the samosas in batches and fry for 3-4 minutes until golden and crisp.
Remove onto kitchen paper and drain the excess oil.
Serve the s with your favorite accompaniment.

Lobotomize the pumpkins   cut the tops off (if you cut in a zig-zag, its easier to put it back on later), scoop out the seeds and stringy stuff inside. If you want to roast the seeds (totally advisable), rinse them off and set aside. Pack the stuffing inside the pumpkins, replace tops. Put the pumpkins on a baking sheet in the preheated oven, and cover with tinfoil or an additional baking sheet inverted. Serve  with the lids on, and let eaters open them.

ingredients: Cooked rice      or traditional meal, for serving
While the mince is rehydrating, chop the onions , garlic , and mushrooms  into small pieces.
In a large pan or skillet, heat the olive  oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions  and garlic , and cook until softened and fragrant.
Add the mushrooms  to the pan and continue cooking until they have softened and released their juices.
Remove the mushrooms , onions , and garlic  from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the rehydrated soya mince and cook for a few minutes until it starts to brown.
Pour the vegetable broth into the pan and stir well, scraping up any bits stuck to the bottom.
Add the cooked mushrooms , onions , and garlic  back into the pan with the soya mince. Stir in the salt  to taste.
Allow the mixture to simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has reduced and the flavors have melded together.
Stir in the sour cream until well combined. Let the stroganoff cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve the stroganoff over cooked rice or traditional meal and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.

This is a delicious and hearty vegetarian meal that is sure to satisfy. The combination of rehydrated soya mince and earthy mushrooms creates a rich and flavorful dish that is perfect for a cozy dinner at home. Serve it over your choice of rice or traditional meal for a complete meal.

ingredients: _Mango Coconut Overnight Oats with Vegan Yogurt_
cup coconut milk (or any plant-based milk)
Optional toppings sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
In a medium-sized bowl, mix together the rolled oats, coconut milk, and vegan yogurt until well combined.
Add in the diced mango, chia seeds, and shredded coconut. Stir well to evenly distribute all the ingredients.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or transfer the mixture into an airtight container.
Place the bowl or container in the refrigerator and let the oats soak overnight, or for at least 6-8 hours.
In the morning, give the oats a quick stir. If the mixture is too thick, you can add more coconut milk or water to achieve your desired consistency.
Transfer the oat mixture into serving bowls or jars. Top with sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and a drizzle of honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious for a quick and easy breakfast or snack option.
You can use any type of vegan yogurt for this recipe, such as almond or coconut yogurt.
If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add a bit more honey or maple syrup to the oats before soaking overnight.
The chia seeds and shredded coconut add extra fiber and healthy fats, but you can omit them if desired.
For a tropical twist, you can also add some diced pineapple or banana to the oats.
This recipe can be easily doubled or tripled to make multiple servings for meal prep.
You can also use frozen mango if fresh is not available, just make sure to let it thaw before adding it to the oat mixture.

Ingredients Required
__________

1 tablespoon olive    oil

12 cup minced onion    (about 12 small onion)

1 garlic    clove, minced

4 -6 cups vegetable broth

1 (14 ounce) can whole tomatoes , coarsely chopped

Salt  

10 ounces fresh spinach or 10 ounces frozen spinach, defrosted and chopped


Directions to Prepare
__________

In a soup    pot , heat olive oil over medium high heat.

Saute the onion    and garlic , stirring often until onions    are translucent, about 5 to 7 minutes.

Add broth and tomatoes , turn heat    up to high, and bring to a boil.

 Add spinach and taste, adjusting seasonings with salt .

Serve  immediately.

ingredients: An easy cultured vegan yogurt recipe thats smooth, tangy, exceptionally thick  creamy  just perfect for dolloping on anything and everything Easy to make with or without an Instant Pot.
a large bowl of yogurt with chocolate granola and raspberries
Were jumping back on the fermentation train for this vegan yogurt recipe. And its a whole lot quicker and easier than making sourdough starter or sourdough bread so youre A-Ok
And this vegan yogurt is so good Were talking sheer yogurt decadence. Its smooth, tangy and unlike many other homemade vegan yogurt recipes, it is exceptionally thick and creamy.

Yep, this cultured vegan yogurt recipe is THICK. And it continues to thicken as it sits in the fridge. If you leave it there for a few days its almost Greek yogurt-like. And you wont be needing any expensive probiotics, powdered starters or thickeners like agar agar, tapioca or xanthan gum either.

Most mainstream yogurt you buy at the grocery store is made with dairy, usually cows milk, but also sometimes sheep or goat milk. This means it is not vegan. However, there are a growing number of really good store bought vegan yogurts available. They are made with plant-based milks like coconut milk, oat milk, almond milk, cashew milk and soy milk.
a tray with open jars of vegan yogurt on it

Most vegan yogurt contains the same gut-friendly probiotics that non-vegan yogurts do, and that includes this recipe, which when made the first time is seeded with probiotics from a store bought yogurt and then cultured. For future batches you can use a spoonful of your own homemade yogurt to start the culturing process which means you wont need one from the store.
Wondering how you can possibly make vegan yogurt without probiotics or special yogurt starters
These are the ingredients you need to make my vegan yogurt recipe and why you need them

Light canned coconut milk - Light canned coconut milk because it gives consistent results and makes the yogurt really rich, decadent, thick and creamy without an obvious coconut taste. I do not recommend you use any other milk.
Raw cashew nuts - These add a lovely cashew flavour and also work to make this yogurt extra thick and creamy.

A tiny bit of store bought vegan yogurt - This acts as the starter. It contains the live cultures that will ferment your yogurt. You only need this the first time you make it. For subsequent batches you can use a tiny bit of your own homemade vegan yogurt instead.

Maple syrup - Maple syrup is always my first choice because it is the most natural sweetener, but or agave or white/cane sugar will work too. Its necessary for the bacteria to feed on. It wont make your yogurt sweet.
You will also need some glass jars with lids. I use cleaned up empty jam jars. I dont recommend making this recipe in one big pot, or directly in the inner pot of an Instant Pot.
small jars of vegan yogurt, one with a spoon in it and one topped with fruit
Do I Need An Instant Pot To Make Vegan Yogurt
Want know how to make the best vegan yogurt
Its much easier than you might think and you can make it with an Instant Pot or without one.
Heres exactly how its done with step-by-step pictures
Step 1 - Soak the cashews in boiling water.
Step 2 - Add them and the other ingredients to a blender and blend until completely smooth.
vegan yogurt mixture in a blender
jars of vegan yogurt before culturing
Step 4 - Place in an Instant Pot on the yogurt setting or leave in a warm place to ferment.
jars of vegan yogurt in an Instant Pot
Step 5 - Chill thoroughly before serving. When you remove it from the fridge it will be very thick. The longer you leave it there the thicker it will get.
The fermentation makes it really bubbly. Heres what it will look like when you first spoon some out
thick vegan yogurt in a jar with a spoon removed showing the bubbly fermented texture
It will be incredibly thick but once you stir it up it becomes super, silky smooth like this
smooth and creamy vegan yogurt in a jar
Step 6 - IMPORTANT - Before you eat it all remember to save a few tablespoons of yogurt to culture your next batch
How To Culture Yogurt Without An Instant Pot

The easiest way to incubate and culture your homemade vegan yogurt is with an Instant Pot that has a yogurt setting. That will keep it at a consistent temperature throughout with no effort from you. And its no secret that I love my Instant Pot. I use it for something nearly every single day, including recipes like my Instant Pot Black Beans, Instant Pot Portobello Pot Roast and Instant Pot Tomato Soup and also for cooking rice, grains and oatmeal etc.

A yogurt maker would work well too and if you dont have either of those then you will need to keep your yogurt at a temperature of between 29  C (85  F) and 46  C (115  F). Anything below 29  C (85  F) and youll have trouble getting it to culture.

It is also really important that the yogurt doesnt get close to or above 49C (120 F) because at that temperature the yogurt cultures will start to be killed off and the recipe wont work. Because of this I highly suggest you check the temperature of the yogurts location with a thermometer before you start incubating it if you arent using the controlled environment of an Instant Pot or yogurt maker.
Here are some suggestions for ways to keep your yogurt warm so it cultures successfully
Warm house - If your house is around 29 C (85 F) or more you can leave the covered jars on your countertop away from direct sunlight and in a spot where they wont be disturbed.

In your oven - Preheat your oven to 200  C (400 F) for 1 minute then turn it off. Sit your jars on a baking tray and place them in the oven on the top shelf with the oven light on. Do not open the door for at least 10 hours or the heat will escape.
Use your home heating - Place your jars of yogurt near (but not too near) the furnace, radiator, fireplace, stove.
On top of your fridge/fridge freezer - This is usually a nice warm spot and works well if you dont have built in appliances.
A warm closet - I have forced air heating in my house and the closets have vents into them and get really warm.
a jar of creamy vegan yogurt with a spoon in it
Follow the recipe exactly. Vegan yogurt is finicky. If you make any changes at all it might not work as well or even at all.
Be sure to soak the cashews even if you have a high powered blender. We want this super-duper smooth.
Do not omit the sweetener. It is necessary for the bacteria to feed on. Dont worry, your yogurt wont taste sweet because its all consumed by the time the yogurt has fermented.

Canned light coconut milk should be used to make this vegan yogurt recipe. I dont recommend using full fat coconut milk as it will make the yogurt too firm and it also tends to cause separation to occur. Dont be tempted to buy full fat canned coconut milk and dilute it yourself to make light coconut milk. That will not work in this recipe.

Ensure the yogurt you use to seed your yogurt is a cultured/live one. Most are but double check. If you dont like the results using a particular brand of yogurt try another one next time. Better quality yogurts will give better results.
Makes sure everything is very, very clean.

For this recipe I recommend incubating the yogurt in glass jars. I do not recommend you make it in one big pot, like the Instant Pots inner pot. This is because this yogurt gets the very best texture when it is completely undisturbed while it incubates and chills. If you stir it or disturb it you will lose the lovely thick, creamy texture.
If using an Instant Pot do not set your jars on the trivet. They need to be directly in contact with the inner pot. Dont use the trivet at all.
Dont use metal utensils, pots or bowls as theres a small chance prolonged contact with them could harm the bacteria in the yogurt.
Try not to disturb the yogurt in the jars. It gets much thicker if you leave it well alone.
If youve got an Instant Pot with a yogurt function use it. It makes this process so easy
I like to make my yogurt just before I go to bed. That way the incubation time happens while you sleep.

I dont recommend adding anything prior to culturing your vegan yogurt because it might hinder the process, but after it has cultured and chilled and you are happy with tanginess feel free to stir though

Keep your vegan yogurt in lidded jars in the refrigerator. It will keep for 7 to 10 days depending on your fridge temperature. It will continue to thicken and get more tangy. I do not recommend freezing this yogurt.
Uses for vegan yogurt are wide and varied. I suggest keeping a jar in the fridge at all times so you can eat it on repeat for breakfast, snack and dessert.
a healthy chocolate banana breakfast bar with a dollop of yogurt on top
Its very hard to make thick vegan yogurt without adding a thickener of some kind. Store bought vegan yogurts all contain them. The most common thickeners are agar agar, tapioca flour or xanthan gum.

In this recipe though we are blending soaked cashew nuts into the light coconut milk to naturally thicken it. The combination of the creamy canned coconut milk, the cashews and the fermentation make a really thick and creamy vegan yogurt.
a bowl of vegan yogurt topped with granola and fresh raspberries
An easy cultured vegan yogurt recipe thats smooth, tangy, exceptionally thick  creamy  just perfect for dolloping on anything and everything
PREP TIME 10minutes minutesFERMENTATION TIME 10hours hoursTOTAL TIME 10hours hours 10minutes minutesSERVINGS 6 servings of about Â½ cup (60ml)
standard can (400ml / 13.5 oz) light canned coconut milk (no other milk will work)  see notes

tablespoons vegan yogurt , be sure it is one with live probiotic cultures. Almost all are but double check. Note that you only need store bought yogurt the first time you make it then you use your own homemade yogurt for subsequent batches
tablespoons maple syrup , or agave or the same amount of white or cane sugar (do not omit - and dont worry, the yogurt will not taste sweet)

Make sure everything you will be using is scrupulously clean. I run my glass jars, and lids through the dishwasher on the hottest setting. You can also wash them in hot soapy water and put them on a baking tray in an oven at 135 C (275F) for 15 to 20 minutes or clean the jars in hot soapy water, rinse them, then put them still drippy and wet into the microwave. Microwave them on high for 45 seconds (do not put metal lids in the microwave - Soak them in boiling water). I also wash my blender jar in hot soapy water, then rinse and fill with boiling water from the kettle, let it sit for a few minutes then pour it out.
Put the cashews in a small bowl and cover them completely with boiling water. Leave them to soak for 20 to 30 minutes. Dont skip this step.
Run a kettle of boiling water through your sieve then drain the cashews really well and add them to a blender. Add the coconut milk, yogurt and maple syrup, then blend until it is completely smooth.

Decant the mixture into clean and dry jars. Any combination of jar sizes that will hold a total of about 600ml (just under 3 cups). I like to use small ones so I have individual sized servings. If you plan on using an Instant Pot make sure before you start filling the jars that they will fit easily together inside the metal inner bowl.

If using an Instant Pot - Place the uncovered yogurt filled jars into the metal inner pot of the Instant Pot. Do not use the trivet and do not add any water to the pot. The jars should be in direct contact with the bottom of the pot and have no lids or other covering on them. Place the lid of the Instant Pot on and close it, then close the steam vent. Press the yogurt button (check that the display says normal and not boil, then adjust the time depending on how long you would like your yogurt to ferment. I suggest a minimum of 10 hours. That will give you a nice thickness and a slight tang. 11.5 hours will give you a more pronounced tang and is how long I leave mine. Do not disturb the Instant Pot/yogurt during this time. You can check it after 10 or 11 hours though. Use a spoon to take a little bit from one jar (without stirring it up first)and taste it. Put the Instant Pot back on again for another hour or two if its not quite tangy enough.

If you dont have an Instant Pot - Cover the filled jars with cheesecloth, clean fluff-free dish towels/cloths, any clean breathable fabric, or paper towels and elastic bands or string to hold it in place. To culture successfully you need to keep the yogurt at a consistent temperature of anywhere between 29  C (85  F) and 46  C (115  F).
If your house is 29 C (85 F) or more you can leave the covered jars on your countertop away from direct sunlight.

If your house is cooler than that, turn your oven to 200  C (400 F) for just 1 minute and no longer. Then turn it off and turn the oven light on. Place the covered jars on a baking tray (for stability) in the oven on the top shelf, with just the oven light on. Do not open the door while it is culturing or you will let the heat out. Also make sure that no-one turns the oven on. A note stuck to the door is a good idea.

Do not disturb the yogurt while it is culturing. At 38  C (100 F) the yogurt will take between 10 to 12 hours to culture, thicken nicely and get a good tang. If the temperature is cooler than that it will take longer and if its warmer then it will happen more quickly. I suggest testing it by scooping a tiny bit out and tasting it after about 10 hours have passed, then add on more time if you want it to be tangier.

Remember that at anything much below a temperature of 29  C (85  F), culturing the yogurt could be problematic, and anything much over 49C (120 F) and the good bacteria will be killed. The yogurt will not culture if that happens. To be absolutely sure that conditions will be right I suggest having a practice run before. Check the temperature of your oven with a thermometer after your oven has preheated for the 1 minute and the light has been turned on. If you find it isnt in the right temperature range there are more suggestions in the recipe notes for ways to incubate.

Once the yogurt has incubated and has reached the right amount of tanginess for you, cover securely with a lid and refrigerate thoroughly. Do not stir it. For best results it needs to be undisturbed until completely chilled. It will thicken more as it chills and will continue to thicken the longer you leave it before eating.
Remember to save a few tablespoons of your yogurt so that you can use it to culture your next batch of homemade vegan yogurt.
If you prefer a sweet yogurt, add more sweetener after the yogurt has fermented and chilled.

The milk you use must be light canned coconut milk.  Light coconut milk gives the best and most consistent results. You absolutely cannot use homemade coconut milk, coconut milk from a carton, diluted full fat canned coconut milk, or any other type of plant milk for this recipe. They will not work.  I do not recommend using full fat canned coconut milk because it tends to cause separation issues and makes the yogurt way too thick (almost solid) when chilled.
For slightly thinner yogurt you can safely increase the amount of light coconut milk to 480 ml / 2 cups.

Use glass jars - For this recipe I recommend incubating the yogurt in glass jars. I do not recommend you make it in one big pot, like the Instant Pots inner pot. This is because this yogurt gets the very best texture when it is completely undisturbed while it incubates and chills. If you stir it or disturb it you will lose the lovely thick, creamy texture.

Temperature - If you dont use an Instant Pot or yogurt maker which will control the temperature and keep it consistent, I would highly suggest you check the temperature of the yogurts location with a thermometer. It is really important that the yogurt stays consistently between 29  C (85  F) and 46  C (115  F).

Directions to Prepare
__________

Heat    the oil in a large    skillet.

Turn heat    down to medium.

Add turmeric, ground coriander, salt .

SautÃ© for 8-10 minutes.

Add 14 cup water    and cover immediately.

Turn heat    very low and steam vegetables for 7-10 minutes (until tender).

Serve.

267 73 183 773 6 Healthy Homemade Salad      Dressings

_These six healthy salad dressing recipes are easy to make and store in your fridge. Try them all or choose your favorites  balsamic, peanut    ginger, apple   cider vinegar, avocado, raspberry  vinaigrette, and honey  mustard salad    dressing._

_Six colorful jars of homemade salad dressing surrounded with vegetables and fruit._

_6 Healthy Salad    Dressings Overview_

Have you ever wondered how you could make your favorite salad dressings in a healthy, more affordable version This post shares 6 healthy salad      dressing recipes that are packed full of nutrition and easy to make

_These salad    dressing recipes are so simple and easy to make. Once you try a few of these recipes youll quickly learn which ones are your favorites and what dishes youd like to pair them with._

These recipes arent just great for salads  You can use them in quinoa bowls, on top of roasted veggies, pasta dishes, or even as a marinade

_All of these dressings are made with whole natural ingredients that youll feel good about sharing with your family. Each recipe makes about 1 Â½ cups, which is the perfect size to store in 8 oz mason jars._

A jar of apple   cider vinegar dressing with ingredients including olive    oil, apple   cider vinegar, dijon mustard, garlic , salt  and pepper.

1. Apple   Cider Vinegar Salad      Dressing

INGREDIENTS

1 cup olive    oil

Â½ cup apple   cider vinegar

Â½ Tbsp dijon mustard

1 garlic  clove  minced

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS

Combine 1 cup olive    oil, Â½ cup apple   cider vinegar, Â½ Tbsp dijon mustard, 1 minced garlic  clove, Â½ tsp salt  and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper in a container or mason jar.

_Seal the lid and shake up to mix. This dressing can be stored in the fridge for up to two weeks. Reshake before using again._

A jar of balsamic dressing with ingredients listed including balsamic vinegar, olive    oil, honey , dijon mustard, garlic , salt , pepper.

2. Balsamic Salad     Dressing Recipe

INGREDIENTS

Â¾ cup balsamic vinegar

Â½ cup olive    oil

1 Tbsp honey  or pure maple syrup

1 tsp dijon mustard

1 garlic  clove  minced

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

_DIRECTIONS Combine Â¾ cup balsamic vinegar, Â½ cup olive    oil, 1 Tbsp honey , 1 tsp dijon mustard, 1 minced garlic  clove, Â½ tsp salt  and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper in a container or mason jar._

Seal the lid and shake up to mix. Store in the fridge for up to two weeks. Re-shake the jar before using it again.

_A mason jar of peanut    butter dressing with ingredients listed beside peanut    butter, soy sauce, lemon    juice, honey , ginger root , and garlic ._

3. Peanut    Butter    Salad    Dressing

INGREDIENTS

Â½ cup peanut    butter  or almond butter

3 Tbsp soy sauce

2 Tbsp honey   or maple syrup

2 Tbsp lemon    juice

Â½ Tbsp freshly grated ginger    

1 garlic  clove  minced

DIRECTIONS Combine Â½ cup peanut    butter, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 Tbsp honey , 2 Tbsp lemon    juice, Â½ Tbsp freshly grated ginger , and 1 minced garlic  clove together in a container or mason jar. Seal the lid and shake up to mix. Store in the fridge for up to two weeks. Re-shake the jar before using it again.

A jar of creamy avocado    dressing with a sliced avocado beside it. Ingredients are listed beside include avocado , cilantro, olive    oil, lime    juice, water , garlic , salt  and pepper.

4. Creamy Avocado    Salad Dressing

INGREDIENTS

1 ripe avocado   peeled and pitted

Â½ cup water     

Â½ cup chopped cilantro

Â¼ cup olive    oil

Â¼ cup lime  juice

1 garlic  clove  minced

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

The instructions for this dressing are below

_DIRECTIONS Add 1 ripe avocado , Â½ cup water , Â½ cup chopped cilantro, Â¼ cup olive    oil, Â¼ cup lime  juice, 1 minced garlic  clove, Â½ tsp salt , and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper all to a blender and blend until smooth and creamy._

Pour into a container or mason jar. Store in the fridge for up to 3-4 days. Re-shake the jar before using it again.

A jar of honey  mustard salad    dressing and ingredients listed including olive    oil, lemon  juice, dijon mustard, honey  salt  and pepper.

5. Honey  Mustard Salad    Dressing

INGREDIENTS

1 cup olive    oil

Â½ cup lemon  juice

2 Tbsp dijon mustard

2 Tbsp honey  

Â½ tsp salt  

Â¼ tsp ground black pepper

DIRECTIONS Combine 1 cup olive    oil, Â½ cup lemon  juice, 2 Tbsp dijon mustard, 2 Tbsp honey , Â½ tsp salt , and Â¼ tsp ground black pepper in a container or mason jar.

_Seal the lid and shake up to mix. Store in the fridge for up to two weeks. Re-shake the jar before using it again._

A mason jar of raspberry  vinaigrette with a bowl of fresh raspberries and a list of ingredients including raspberries , olive  oil, lemon  juice, apple   cider vinegar, honey  and salt .

6. Raspberry Vinaigrette

INGREDIENTS

1 cup fresh raspberries

Â¼ cup olive    oil

3 Tbsp apple   cider vinegar

1 Tbsp honey  or pure maple syrup

Â¼ tsp salt  

The instructions for this dressing are below

_DIRECTIONS Add 1 cup fresh raspberries, Â¼ cup olive oil, Â¼ cup lemon juice, 3 Tbsp apple cider vinegar, 1 Tbsp honey and Â¼ tsp salt to a blender and blend until smooth. Pour over salad. This dressing is best when served fresh._

Ingredients Required
__________

2 fresh oranges 

2 cups of jasmine rice (you can also use basmati but plain white rice rarely)

orange    zest

3 cups water     

12 teaspoon salt  

orange    slice, for garnish


Directions to Prepare
__________

_Remove the zest from the orange    and measure out up to 2 tablespoons, if desired. Mince and set aside._

 _To garner the maximum amount of juice from your oranges, with a sharp knife pierce the oranges about 5-6 times and microwave for 30 seconds._

 _Juice the orange    and measure out 34 cup; more or less according to your preference. You may need to juice another orange    if two oranges dont yield enough juice. Remember that for 2 cups of rice    you will need 4 cups of liquid (water orange    juice) in whatever ratio you choose._

 _Place the rice    in a pan along with the water , salt  and orange    juice. NOTE Important to stir in the orange    zest at the end of the cooking time. DO NOT add the zest in with the rice    while it is cooking or the rice    will turn bitter._

 _Cover pan, bring to a boil, reduce heat    and simmer about 20-25 minutes or until liquid is absorbed._

 _Remove pan from stove; fluff rice    with a fork and stir in the zest. Let stand covered for a few minutes then serve ._

 _Garnish with orange      slices if desired._

recipes.instructions: 267 73 947 325 What Is Tempeh (and How to Cook It) What is tempeh and how do you cook it Here Im sharing a guide to all things tempeh along with my favorite marinated tempeh recipe. If youre new to tempeh, youre in the right place because I have created a guide to teach you all about tempeh, its health benefits and how to cook it Tempeh square cut into 4x4 cubes. What is Tempeh You may have seen some of my tempeh recipes and wondered what tempeh is. For starters, its a plant-based protein made of cooked soybeans (think edamame) that have been fermented. The fermentation process binds the soybeans into a cakepatty, which is what youll find at your local grocery store. Some varieties of tempeh only include soybeans, but others will contain grains like barley, rice, flax or millet along with the soybeans. What Does Tempeh Taste Like Tempeh on its own has a mild, nutty flavor thats often described as earthy. Like most proteins, it really takes on the flavor of the dish When prepared with marinades or sauces, it absorbs those flavors and the end result is so tasty. Tempeh vs. Tofu Tempeh is related to tofu, but they arent the same thing They are both made from soy, but other than that theyre actually quite different. Tempeh is less processed, fermented and has a stronger flavor and a bit more texture. Tofu is more processed and has a milder flavor with basically no texture Tofu can be blended up into a creamy sauce or soup or can be fried for more texture, but in general it is much smoother than tempeh. I also find tempeh a bit easier to work with because theres minimal prep work. With tofu you have to account for extra time to press it and with tempeh you simply open the package and youre ready to chop and cook Side by side tempeh rectangles. On the left, the tempeh is out of the packaging, on the right is Lightlife tempeh in the packaging. My Favorite Brand of Tempeh Ive tried a ton of different tempeh varieties and Lightlife is definitely my favorite for a few reasons its organic, GMO-free and easy to find in mainstream stores. I gravitate towards the Three Grain variety because it is the mildest in terms of taste, but I like the original as well You can buy tempeh in most major grocery stores and at every health food store. Youll find it in the refrigerated section, usually by the produce or other plant-based proteins. A square of tempeh that has been sliced into long, thin sections. Health Benefits of Tempeh Tempeh is incredibly healthy Not only is it a complete protein, but its a good source of iron, prebiotics, B vitamins and manganese. A 1 cup serving of tempeh has a whopping 31 grams of protein As I mentioned above, tempeh is a fermented food. This fermentation process breaks down phytic acid, which can inhibit mineral absorption. This means the minerals in tempeh are easier to digest and tempeh is also less likely to cause gas or indigestion when compared to other beans. I dont know about you, but less gas and bloating is always a win in my book Cutting Tempeh Three versions of tempeh that have been sliced, cubed, and cut into triangles. There are so many different ways to cut tempeh, but here are my go-to methods Thin slices if Im using tempeh to make my tempeh bacon, blackened tempeh salad or vegan breakfast sandwich I like to cut the tempeh into 14 thick stripsslices. Cubes or triangles if the tempeh is the star of the recipe like in this vegan sweet and sour or tempeh butternut squash bake I like to cut it into cubes or triangles. For cubes, just try to keep cut them into the same sized cubes so they cook evenly. To cut tempeh into triangles, cut the tempeh in half width-wise. Cut each half in a star pattern to get 16 mini triangles per package of tempeh, 32 triangles total. Crumbled crumbled tempeh is a great substitute for recipes that typically have ground meat like these tempeh tacos or this tempeh bolognese sauce. To crumble tempeh, simply break it apart with your hands until you reach a desired consistency, similar to that of ground meat. A close up of tempeh triangles marinating in a maple balsamic glaze. How to Cook Tempeh Packaged tempeh is pre-cooked so you can easily enjoy it right from the package (on sandwiches, salads, etc), but I highly recommend cooking it so that it tastes better. A lot of people suggest steaming the tempeh before marinating or cooking to help remove any bitterness. I honestly dont take the time to do this, but if youd like to try it heres the process. To steam the tempeh, cut it as desired, place in a steamer basket, cover and steam for 10-15 minutes. If you dont have a steamer basket, you can fill a saucepan with 1-2 inches of water and bring it to a boil. Once boiling place the tempeh in the saucepan, cover and reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes. My favorite way to make tempeh taste amazing is to marinate it You can marinate in the fridge anywhere from one hour to overnight. The longer it marinates the longer the tempeh has time to soak up all the flavors. Im sharing a simple tempeh marinade below made of maple syrup, balsamic vinegar, oil, tamari and garlic. Its a staple recipe in our house Once your tempeh is prepped and marinated, its time to cook it You have a few options. Heres what I recommend Pan sautÃ© I typically sautÃ© my tempeh. Heat 1 Tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tempeh and cook until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes per side. Bake Baking tempeh is a great hands-off cooking option Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Spread the tempeh evenly and bake at 400ÂºF for about 25 minutes or until golden brown. Air fry If you have an air fryer, this is a great option for crispy and delicious tempeh Add the tempeh to the basket and bake at 375ÂºF for about 15 minutes. Toss every 5 minutes for even cooking. Marinated tempeh thats finished cooking in a large skillet. How to Serve This Marinated Tempeh This marinated tempeh is lovely served over rice or another grain like quinoa or millet. You can also serve it on cauliflower rice for a low-carb option. You can also pair it with a veggie side like my roasted broccoli or kale salad or try it in my tempeh bowls with pumpkin rice. This easy marinated tempeh is my favorite way to cook tempeh. The maple balsamic sauce gives the tempeh so much flavor Prep Time 1hour hour Cook Time 12minutes minutes Total Time 1hour hour 12minutes minutes Servings 6 Ingredients 1x 2x 3x 2 8 oz packages tempeh Â¼ cup maple syrup Â¼ cup balsamic vinegar 2 teaspoons avocado , or olive oil 3 Tablespoons low sodium tamari, soy sauce or coconut aminos 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 Tablespoon avocado or olive oil, for cooking Remove tempeh from package and chop into small triangles by cutting the tempeh in half width-wise. Cut each half in a star pattern to get 16 mini triangles per package of tempeh, 32 triangles total. In a small bowl combine maple syrup, balsamic vinegar, tamari, 2 teaspoons oil and minced garlic. Add tempeh triangles into a shallow dish with a large surface area, pour maple balsamic marinade over the tempeh, toss to coat and let tempeh marinate in the fridge for 1 24 hours. Stir the mixture a couple times while marinating, if possible. Pan-glaze the tempeh by heating 1 Tablespoon avocado oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once oil is hot, add the tempeh (without pouring the marinade in) and cook until golden brown on each side, allowing 4-5 minutes per side. Pour the maple balsamic marinade into the pan with the tempeh and simmer another 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has reduced creating a glaze on the tempeh. Toss the tempeh a couple times during this process. Once the sauce has thickened and all tempeh pieces are coated, the tempeh is ready to be served. I recommend serving it over rice, cauliflower rice or another grain and a veggie side.

ingredients: Pumpkin     and Potato     Curry with Basmati Rice
In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the onions are soft and translucent.
Add the cubed pumpkin and potatoes to the pot. Stir to combine with the onion mixture.
In a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, and turmeric. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the vegetables in the pot. Stir to coat the vegetables evenly.
Pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. Stir well and bring the curry to a simmer.

Allow the curry to cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the pumpkin and potatoes are soft and cooked through. If the curry becomes too thick, add a splash of water or more vegetable broth.
Taste the curry and add salt, if needed, to adjust the seasoning.
Serve the pumpkin and potato curry over a bed of cooked basmati rice. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro, if desired.

Enjoy this flavorful and hearty as a delicious and satisfying meal. The creamy coconut milk and warm spices make this curry the perfect comfort food for a chilly evening. This recipe is also great for meal prepping and can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

267 73 183 773 _Roasted Eggplant    (Aubergine) Spread_


Ingredients Required
__________

1 medium eggplant  

2 red bell peppers , seeded

1 red onion , peeled

2 garlic  cloves, minced

3 tablespoons olive    oil

1 12 teaspoons salt 

1 tablespoon tomato    paste


Directions to Prepare
__________

Preheat    the oven to 400 degrees F.

Cut the eggplant , bell pepper , and onion    into 1-inch cubes.

Toss them in a large bowl with the garlic , olive    oil, salt .

Spread them on a baking sheet; roast for 45 minutes, until the vegetables are lightly browned and soft, tossing once during cooking.

Cool slightly.

Place the vegetables in a food processor fitted with a steel blade, add the tomato    paste, and pulse 3 or 4 times to blend.

It should still have a lot of texture left, and not completely pureed.

Taste for salt .

Serve

recipes.name: Spicy Beetroot and Carrot Salad with Cumin and Coriander
ingredients: One cup dried will yield about 4 cups cooked.
Vegetable broth 4-5 cups is usually enough to submerge the lentils as they cook thoroughly.
Carrot, celery stalk, and medium onion.
These aromatic vegetables add a wonderful depth of flavor to the soup.
They also provide a hint of sweetness and freshness that balances out the earthiness of the lentils.
Tomato  adding color to the lentil soup; use fresh chopped tomato, but tomato sauce or tomato paste can also work.
Bay leaves A common ingredient in Italian soups and stews. It adds a subtle herbal note and enhances the overall flavor of the soup.
Sea salt to taste Season generously towards the end.
Extra virgin olive oil For sautÃ©ing the soffritto and for the serving.
Drizzle some high-quality olive oil over the finished soup before serving.
Rinse the lentils thoroughly. This helps remove any impurities and ensures a clean taste.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add the diced onion, carrot, and celery, and sautÃ© until they soften.
Add the rinsed lentils, bay leaf, chopped tomato, and broth to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then let it simmer in a lower heat for about 30-40 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Once the lentils are cooked, remove the bay leaf and season the soup with salt.
Ladle the hot soup into bowls and finish with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh basil or parsley.
Serve as a main course with crusty bread or your favorite side dish.
TOP TIPS FOR A DELICIOUS SOUP
Rinse dried lentils well before cooking to remove any dust or debris.
Lentil soup thickens as it sits  add more broth as needed when reheating.
Use vegetable stock to make a vegetarian lentil soup.
Veggie power Add more vegetables to the mix.
Zucchini, swiss chard, bell peppers, baby spinach, or fresh kale can be excellent additions to boost the nutritional value.
Creamy soup If you prefer a creamier texture, blend a portion of the cooked soup using an immersion or regular blender.
Pour it back into the pot and stir to combine.
Add Pasta Its something nice to do with leftovers the next day.
Cook the pasta directly in the lentils, adding about 2 cups of water. Serve with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
If you have leftovers or want to make a big batch of Italian lentil soup ahead of time, heres how you can store it
Fridge Allow the soup to cool completely before transferring it to an airtight container.
It will stay fresh in the refrigerator for 4-5 days.
Freeze If you want to extend the soups shelf life, freezing is the way to go.
Portion the soup into freezer-safe containers or resealable freezer bags, leaving some room for expansion. It can be frozen for three months.
Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
DO YOU SOAK THE LENTILS BEFORE COOKING
No, you dont need to soak the lentils before cooking.
_Unlike some other legumes, lentils cook relatively quickly without pre-soaking. Just give them a good rinse before putting them in the pot._
CAN I USE CANNED LENTILS INSTEAD OF DRY
While dried lentils are preferred for their texture and flavor, you can certainly use canned lentils if youre short on time or like the convenience.
Drain and rinse the canned lentils before adding them to the soup. Remember that canned lentils are already cooked, so youre the cooking time to avoid overcooking them.
CAN I USE OTHER TYPES OF LENTILS
Yes While the recipe calls for dried lentils, you can experiment with different types, such as green lentils, brown, or black.
Red tomatoes, or a can of tomatoes
cups of Vegetable broth as needed
_Rinse the lentils and drain and dice the carrot, celery, and onion._
In a high-sided pot, sautÃ© the diced carrot, celery and onion.
_When they are golden brown, add the diced tomato, basil leaves, and bay leaf which will give the dish an excellent aroma._
Cook for about 3 minutes, and at this point, add the drained lentils.
_Cook for a couple of minutes and add the broth._
Continue cooking with the lid on. If the lentil soup gets too dry, add more broth.
_Once the lentils are cooked, add salt and pepper to the soup, stir, and serve hot with a drizzle of olive oil and more fresh herbs._
Serve it with garlic bread or croutons. Alternatively, you can add some pasta or rice.
_If you like strong flavors, you can add a pinch of Chili Powder, Turmeric, or Ginger to the Lentil Soup._

ingredients: _Creamy Mashed Potatoes with Garlic and Herbs_
kg potatoes, peeled and cut into small chunks
cup of plant based milk (soya milk   )
/4 cup of fresh herbs (such as parsley, chives, and thyme), chopped
In a large pot, add the potatoes and enough water to cover them. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook for about 15 minutes or until the potatoes are fork-tender.
Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Using a potato masher or fork, mash the potatoes until they are smooth and creamy.
In a small saucepan, heat the milk and minced garlic over medium heat until it starts to simmer.
Pour the hot milk and garlic mixture over the mashed potatoes and stir until well combined.
Add chopped herbs, salt, to the potatoes and mix until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
For a creamier texture, you can use an electric hand mixer to blend the potatoes until they reach your desired consistency.
Serve the hot, garnished with extra chopped herbs on top for added flavor and presentation.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful as a side dish for any meal. This dish pairs perfectly with roasted meats, grilled vegetables, or can even be enjoyed on its own. You can also adjust the amount of garlic and herbs according to your personal taste preference.

recipes.name: Moroccan Chickpea and Okra Stew
ingredients: _Spicy Okra and Tomato Curry with Caramelized Onions_
tip of a teaspoon of cayenne pepper
Begin by washing and drying 500 grams of okra. Remove the tops and tips of the okra and cut them into 1-inch pieces.

Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to brown. Remove the okra from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add 2 large sliced onions and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are caramelized.
While the onions are caramelizing, chop 400 grams of tomatoes into small pieces. Crush 2 cloves of garlic and grate 1 tablespoon of ginger.
Once the onions are caramelized, add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes until they start to break down.
Add 1 teaspoon each of cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the pan and mix well.
Return the okra to the pan and stir everything together. Add salt to taste.
Cover the pan and let the curry simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the okra is tender.
Once the okra is cooked, remove the lid and let the curry cook for an additional 5 minutes to thicken.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve.
Enjoy the delicious and flavorful combination of spicy okra and sweet caramelized onions

ingredients: _Mango Coconut Overnight Oats with Vegan Yogurt_
cup coconut milk (or any plant-based milk)
Optional toppings sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
In a medium-sized bowl, mix together the rolled oats, coconut milk, and vegan yogurt until well combined.
Add in the diced mango, chia seeds, and shredded coconut. Stir well to evenly distribute all the ingredients.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or transfer the mixture into an airtight container.
Place the bowl or container in the refrigerator and let the oats soak overnight, or for at least 6-8 hours.
In the morning, give the oats a quick stir. If the mixture is too thick, you can add more coconut milk or water to achieve your desired consistency.
Transfer the oat mixture into serving bowls or jars. Top with sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and a drizzle of honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious for a quick and easy breakfast or snack option.
You can use any type of vegan yogurt for this recipe, such as almond or coconut yogurt.
If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add a bit more honey or maple syrup to the oats before soaking overnight.
The chia seeds and shredded coconut add extra fiber and healthy fats, but you can omit them if desired.
For a tropical twist, you can also add some diced pineapple or banana to the oats.
This recipe can be easily doubled or tripled to make multiple servings for meal prep.
You can also use frozen mango if fresh is not available, just make sure to let it thaw before adding it to the oat mixture.

recipes.name: Samp and Vegetable Curry
ingredients: In a large pot , bring 4 cups of water     to a boil. Add the samp and let it cook for 30 minutes or until tender. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat    the olive    oil over medium heat . Add the onion , garlic , red bell pepper    and carrot . Saute for 5 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
Add the chopped broccoli    and continue to cook for another 5 minutes.
Stir in the cooked samp, dried thyme, dried oregano, salt . Mix well until all the ingredients are combined.
Pour the vegetable broth over the mixture and stir to combine. Let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Grease a casserole dish with some olive    oil. Transfer the samp and vegetable mixture into the casserole dish.
Sprinkle the frozen peas    on top of the casserole.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
After 30 minutes, remove the aluminum foil and bake for another 10 minutes or until the top is golden brown.
Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious meal

recipes.name: Tomato and Cassava Fritters
ingredients: Peel the cassava and cut it into small cubes. Place the cassava cubes in a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 15 minutes.
While the cassava is cooking, chop the tomatoes and onion into small pieces. Set aside.

Drain the cassava and mash it in a bowl until it becomes a smooth paste. Add in the chopped tomatoes and onion, along with the salt,  olive oil, parsley, cilantro, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin. Mix well.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Gradually add in the flour, stirring until a smooth batter forms.

Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of oil. Once hot, scoop about 1/4 cup of the cassava mixture onto the pan and flatten it into a pancake shape. Repeat with the remaining mixture, leaving enough space between each pancake.
Cook the pancakes for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
Remove the pancakes from the pan and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil.
Serve the warm, topped with your favorite condiments such as sour cream or salsa.

Enjoy your delicious and unique twist on traditional pancakes with the added flavor and nutrition of cassava, tomato, and onion. These pancakes are perfect for breakfast, brunch, or even as a savory snack.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: In a large pot, heat the vegetable broth and keep it on a low simmer.
In a separate pot, melt 2 tablespoons of butter    over medium heat. Add the diced onion    and minced garlic    and cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the sliced mushrooms    to the pot and cook until they have released their water    and are lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
Remove the mushrooms    from the pot and set them aside. In the same pot, add the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and the rice . Stir constantly for 1-2 minutes until the rice    is translucent.

Slowly pour in 1 cup of the simmering vegetable broth and stir until the liquid is absorbed. Continue adding the broth, 1 cup at a time, stirring constantly, until the rice    is al dente, about 20-25 minutes.
Once the rice     is cooked, add the cooked mushrooms    back into the pot and stir to combine.
Gradually pour in 1 cup of milk  and stir until it is fully incorporated into the risotto.
Turn off the heat and stir in the grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt  and pepper    to taste.
Let the risotto sit for 2-3 minutes to thicken and then serve hot , garnished with fresh parsley.

Ugali, also known as posho, nsima, sadza, isitshwala and other names, is a type of corn meal made from maize or corn flour in several countries in Africa. It is cooked in boiling water or milk until it reaches a stiff or firm dough-like consistency.

recipes.notes:
267 73 183 773 _Roasted Eggplant    (Aubergine) Spread_


Ingredients Required
__________

1 medium eggplant  

2 red bell peppers , seeded

1 red onion , peeled

2 garlic  cloves, minced

3 tablespoons olive    oil

1 12 teaspoons salt 

1 tablespoon tomato    paste


Directions to Prepare
__________

Preheat    the oven to 400 degrees F.

Cut the eggplant , bell pepper , and onion    into 1-inch cubes.

Toss them in a large bowl with the garlic , olive    oil, salt .

Spread them on a baking sheet; roast for 45 minutes, until the vegetables are lightly browned and soft, tossing once during cooking.

Cool slightly.

Place the vegetables in a food processor fitted with a steel blade, add the tomato    paste, and pulse 3 or 4 times to blend.

It should still have a lot of texture left, and not completely pureed.

Taste for salt .

Serve

ingredients: Green Beans Mushroom Stirfry. Crunchy, tender green beans and meaty mushroom, a combo made in a skillet. Coated with a lusciously sweet and spicy sauce, this easy 20-minute dish is a lovely side to go with any meal or as a healthy plate as well.
Â½ Lb Green Beans, trimmed and sliced long
Take a bowl. Whisk soy sauce, water, corn starch together.
Heat oil in a pan or wok.
When its hot add chopped garlic to the pan and saute once.
Saute on medium flame till it looks golden brown.
Throw sliced mushrooms in the pan/wok and stir till looks caramelized.
Add green beans to the same pan and mix that with mushrooms.

recipes.name: Mushroom ğŸ„ ğŸ„ ğŸ„ Risotto
ingredients: Cooked rice      or traditional meal, for serving
While the mince is rehydrating, chop the onions , garlic , and mushrooms  into small pieces.
In a large pan or skillet, heat the olive  oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onions  and garlic , and cook until softened and fragrant.
Add the mushrooms  to the pan and continue cooking until they have softened and released their juices.
Remove the mushrooms , onions , and garlic  from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the rehydrated soya mince and cook for a few minutes until it starts to brown.
Pour the vegetable broth into the pan and stir well, scraping up any bits stuck to the bottom.
Add the cooked mushrooms , onions , and garlic  back into the pan with the soya mince. Stir in the salt  to taste.
Allow the mixture to simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the liquid has reduced and the flavors have melded together.
Stir in the sour cream until well combined. Let the stroganoff cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve the stroganoff over cooked rice or traditional meal and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.

This is a delicious and hearty vegetarian meal that is sure to satisfy. The combination of rehydrated soya mince and earthy mushrooms creates a rich and flavorful dish that is perfect for a cozy dinner at home. Serve it over your choice of rice or traditional meal for a complete meal.

recipes.name: Okra and Tomato Stew with Caramelized Onions
ingredients: Begin by preparing the okra. Wash and trim the ends off, then slice into thin rounds. Set aside.
In a large pot, add the soup and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it simmer while you prepare the other ingredients.
In a blender, blend together the onion, tomatoes, red bell peppers until smooth.
Heat up the palm oil on medium-high heat. Add the blended mixture and let it cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the egusi to the pot and stir until well combined. Allow it to cook for 5 more minutes.
Now, add the prepared okra and stir gently. Let it cook for another 5 minutes.
Let the soup simmer on medium heat for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. If the soup becomes too thick, add more water or broth to achieve your desired consistency.
Finally, season with salt  to taste.
Your is now ready to be served. This hearty and flavorful soup is best enjoyed with a side of fufu or pounded yam.

267 73 183 773 _Chickpea Curry (Garbanzos)_


Ingredients Required
__________

1 (16 ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed

1 onion , diced

1 teaspoon fresh ginger , minced

5 garlic  cloves, minced

1 -4 teaspoon mrcurrys.com curry powder (or your favorite curry powder blend)

12 teaspoon salt  

1 medium tomato , diced

2 -3 tablespoons olive    oil

water    


Directions to Prepare
__________

Saute onions    in olive    oil for 3 minutes.

 Add ginger , garlic    and curry powder (you can use about 3 teaspoon for medium-spicy), stir and cook for another minute or so.

 Add chickpeas and salt  and a tablespoon or so of water .

 Cook and stir about a minute.

 Add tomatoes    and cook for 5 minutes, stirring gently.

 Add another spoonful of water    if it seems dry or if its burning or sticking.

Serve with flatbread and rice  or traditional meal .

recipes.name: Spicy Chickpea and Vegetable Nuggets
ingredients: In a large pot, heat some oil over medium heat. Add cumin and coriander seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
Add the diced onion, minced garlic, minced ginger, and chopped green chili. SautÃ© for about 5 minutes, until the onion becomes translucent.
Add the turmeric powder. Stir well to coat the onion mixture.
Pour in the can of diced tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes.
Add the chopped spinach and stir until wilted.
Pour in the can of coconut milk and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer.
Add the drained and rinsed chickpeas. Season with salt to taste.
Let the curry simmer for about 15 minutes, allowing the flavors to develop.
Serve the over cooked rice or with any traditional meal    on the side.
Garnish with fresh coriander before serving.
Enjoy your delicious and healthy vegetarian curry

ingredients: Green Beans Mushroom Stirfry. Crunchy, tender green beans and meaty mushroom, a combo made in a skillet. Coated with a lusciously sweet and spicy sauce, this easy 20-minute dish is a lovely side to go with any meal or as a healthy plate as well.
Â½ Lb Green Beans, trimmed and sliced long
Take a bowl. Whisk soy sauce, water, corn starch together.
Heat oil in a pan or wok.
When its hot add chopped garlic to the pan and saute once.
Saute on medium flame till it looks golden brown.

ingredients: Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the spinach leaves, mushrooms, garlic, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes.

267 75 841 385 _Stir-Fry Mushrooms    and Bell Peppers   _


Ingredients Required
__________

2 tablespoons olive   oil

3 green onions   , sliced

3 garlic  cloves, minced

2 bell peppers , deseeded and diced (the colorful the better)

1 cup mushrooms , sliced

2 -3 tablespoons soy sauce

1 teaspoon sesame oil


Directions to Prepare
__________

Heat oil til really hot .

Stir fry onions  (1 minute), then garlic  (20 seconds).

Then add peppers  and mushrooms . Stir-fry until it becomes a bit soft, (about 2 minutes).

Add the soy sauce and continue to stir for 2 minutes.

When done, remove from heat    and add the sesame sauce mixing it all together, and serve.

ingredients: Prepare the soya chunks by soaking them in hot water for 10 minutes. Drain and squeeze out excess water    from the chunks. Set aside.
Heat a large pan over medium-high heat    and add in the vegetable oil.
Finely chop the garlic    cloves and dice the onion    and red bell pepper .
Add the chopped garlic    to the pan and stir-fry for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add in the diced onion    and bell pepper    and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.
Add in the prepared soya chunks and continue stir-frying for 3-4 minutes until they start to turn slightly golden.
In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Pour this mixture over the soya chunks and vegetables in the pan.
Continue stir-frying for another 2-3 minutes until the soya chunks are fully coated in the sauce and the vegetables are tender.
Remove from heat and serve hot . You can enjoy this dish on its own as a protein-packed meal or serve it with rice or traditional meal for a more filling meal.

267 73 183 773 _Spicy Rice     and Beans   _


Ingredients Required
__________

1 cup onion , chopped

3 cloves garlic , smashed

12 cup celery, chopped

1 tablespoon oil

1 teaspoon ground cumin

1 teaspoon ground coriander

1 12 cups long grain brown rice , uncooked

12 cup grated carrot    

2 34 cups water 

1 bay leaf

1 (14 ounce) can red kidney beans    or 1 (14 ounce) can pinto beans , drained

1 cup chopped tomato    

12 cup fresh corn or 12 cup frozen corn    

1 tablespoon fresh cilantro, chopped (optional)

2 tablespoons fresh parsley


Directions to Prepare
__________

Saute onion , garlic , celery and oil in large non stick frying pan for 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Add cumin, coriander, and rice .

 
Cook on medium, stirring occasionally until golden.

Stir in carrot , water  and bay leaf.

Cover; Simmer on medium low for 20 minutes.

Stir in beans , tomato    and corn .

Cover; heat    for 15 to 20 minutes until liquid is absorbed.

Remove and discard bay leaf.

Stir in cilantro and 1 tablespoon parsley.

Garnish with remaining parsley.

Serve
